Fields of Gold
A local benefactor has donated some land to the City to create a new public space. Several options have been provided by the local citizens, but the final decision is up to you. What do you want to do with this property?
Only 5 allowed in the Empire.
We should use the property to create a new Military Parade Ground.
Build a new Military Parade Ground. Ongoing maintenance will cost 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, but the City will earn 1 [ICON_GREAT_GENERAL] Great General point every turn.
Build a new Naval Parade Ground. Ongoing maintenance will cost 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, but the City will earn 1 [ICON_GREAT_ADMIRAL] Great Admiral point every turn.
We should use it to better our citizens' health. Let's turn this new property into a local farmer market.
A new Farmer's Market is built. The new Farmer's Market carries over 5% of [ICON_FOOD] Food after City growth, but will cost 2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for upkeep.
Commission someone to make an enormous statue of our civilization's great leader...me! This property can be the statue's new home.
A new Statuary Park is built that increases the City's [ICON_CULTURE_LOCAL] Border Growth Rate by 5%.
We should use this space to celebrate the proletariat. Let's use this land to create People's Park.
People's Park is constructed on the land. The new Park grants the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Celebration[ENDCOLOR] Promotion to all Workers built in this City which results in a +15% [ICON_WORKER] Work Rate for those Workers. Park maintenance will cost 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
We should use this space to celebrate our wealth. Let's use this land to create Golden Park.
Golden Park is constructed on the land. Revenue from the new Park grants +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to the City every turn.
We don't need the space. Let's sell the land.
The sale of the land results in {2_InstantYield} for the City's coffers.
This benefactor was a known person of faith. Let's create a park for people to meditate in.
The land is used to build Meditation Park. The new Park grants +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith for every 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens but costs 2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per turn.
Well, our cemeteries are running out of room....
Memorial Park is created on the land. The new Park grants +2 [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points per turn.

University Curriculum
Faculty and administration from the City's University are ready to offer a specalized curriculum. As head of state, they look to you for the final decision on where they should focus. Which would you prefer?
Focus on the hard sciences.
With a new grant from the City totaling 5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per turn, the University is able to expand one of its research deparments and gains +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Liberal arts education is most important.
Utilizing a 5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per turn stipend from the City, local Academies manage to gain +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Divinity education will benefit us the most.
Using the 5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per turn that has been so graciously awarded to the University allows it to chair a new Theology Department resulting in +2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith and a local increase in religious pressure by 10%.
Military education seems most prudent.
The University takes the 5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per turn and uses it to build a new officer training program. This program provides an additional +5 XP for new melee and mounted units built in the City.
I am not interested in making changes at this time. Maybe later?
Nothing happens at this time.
I do not want to change anything at this University.
The local University permanently remains unchanged.

Officer Training Program at University
Provides an additional 5 XP for new melee and mounted units built in this City.
Guild Sponsorship
The local guilds in the City are wanting you to sponsor a promising group of individuals so they can devote more attention to their chosen fields of expertise. Which group would you like to devote our resources to?
I want us to reward the local [ICON_VP_SCIENTIST] Scientists.
[ICON_VP_SCIENTIST] Each Scientist working in the City gains an additional +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science but require a stipend of -4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
I want us to reward the local [ICON_VP_ENGINEER] Engineers.
[ICON_VP_ENGINEER] Each Engineer working in the City gain an additional +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production but requires a stipend of -4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
I want us to reward those in the arts.
[ICON_VP_ENGINEER] Each [ICON_VP_WRITER] Writer, [ICON_VP_ARTIST] Artist, and [ICON_VP_MUSICIAN] working in the City gain an additional +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture but requires a stipend of -4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
I want us to reward the local [ICON_CSD_CIVIL_SERVANT] Civil Servants.
[ICON_CSD_CIVIL_SERVANT] Each Civil Servant working in the City gains an additional +2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism but requires a stipend of -4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
I do not want to show favoritism towards any group of people.
Nothing happens at this time.
School Boards Established
School boards were recently established in the City, and they seek to reform the local public school system. They look to you for guidance. What would you prefer the City's Public School to focus on?
Our schools should emphasize the hard sciences: chemistry, physics, biology!.
The local Public School requires an additional 5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in funding but provide +2% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science in the City.
Our educational system should focus on the arts. We could be developing the next Great Artist.
The local Public School requires an additional 5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in funding but provide +2% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in the City.
We need to provide training to the workforce of tomorrow. We need plumbers, electricians, and welders.
The local Public School requires an additional 5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in funding but provide +2% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in the City
Education should only be available to those who can afford it.
The local Public School provides 5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in the City.
I am not interested in making changes at this time. Maybe later?
Nothing happens at this time.
I do not want to change anything at this Public School.
The local Public School permanently remains unchanged.
